author: Rajulapudi Srinivas
text:
The Forest Department (Wildlife) officials conducted raids in villages in Krishna and West Godavari districts in the Kolleru Wildlife Sanctuary and arrested three persons for hunting birds. They seized 42 dead birds from them.

On a tip-off that some villagers were killing the winged visitors in the protected area in Kolleru Lake, a team conducted the raids at Ingilipaka Lanka village on Wednesday night.

It arrested — Dunga Kiran, Vemalle Chakrapani and Vemalle Prasanth — are residents of Anandapuram village of Krishna district.

The Mandavalli Forest base camp authorities seized black tailed godwit, common teals, large whistling teal, northern pintails and garganey teal species from the accused, said officials.

Birds poisoned

The Kaikalur Veterinary officials conducted post-mortem on the birds on Thursday, and preliminary autopsy report revealed that the birds were poisoned. Viscera samples have been sent to the Regional Forensic Science Laboratory for examination.

“We suspect that the villagers killed the birds my mixing some poisonous substance in the grains. Forest officials are trying to find out if others are involved,” an official said.
title: Three held for hunting migratory birds in Kolleru
